main event: An unidentified flying object was observed in Macon, Georgia on July 11, 1967.
interesting points: The object was observed for 20-25 minutes and changed from a white light to an amber color,The object broke into several smaller pieces before disappearing,Dr. J. Allen Hynek criticized the evaluation suggesting it should be labeled as possible unknown instead of just aircraft,The witness reported that the object made erratic movements and was seen to accelerate rapidly and hover without sound,The observer was a retired USAF captain with experience in identifying aircraft.
sighted object: an unidentified flying object emitting a blue-white glow
witness description: retired captain, USAF, reliable and experienced in observing various types of aircraft
